metadata.Title: CVE-2022-21457 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Server: PAM Auth Plugin). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.28 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 5.9 (Confidentiality impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-21457` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-client - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-router - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-server - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored. mdeslaur> 8.x only

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.5 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
mysql-8.0 package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.29-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
